title: Diwali
description: Diwali, the Festival of Lights, symbolizes the victory of light over darkness and good over evil. Families decorate homes with lamps and fireworks.
significance: Celebrates Lord Rama's return to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile.

title: Pongal
description: Pongal is a harvest festival celebrated in Tamil Nadu with offerings to the Sun God.
significance: Thanksgiving to nature for bountiful harvest.

title: Holi
description: Holi is the festival of colors celebrated with joy, music, and colored powders.
significance: Marks the victory of good over evil and the arrival of spring.

title: Eid-ul-Fitr
description: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan, the holy month of fasting.
significance: Celebrates the completion of a month of blessings and self-control.

title: Christmas
description: Christmas is celebrated to mark the birth of Jesus Christ with prayers, decorations, and joy.
significance: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ.

title: Navratri
description: Navratri is dedicated to Goddess Durga and celebrated with Garba and Dandiya dances.
significance: Symbolizes triumph of good over evil.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Celebrated for Lord Ganesha, with grand processions and idol immersions.
significance: Marks the birth of Lord Ganesha.

title: Onam
description: Onam is Kerala’s harvest festival marked with boat races, dances, and feasts.
significance: Welcomes the mythical King Mahabali.

title: Bihu
description: Bihu is the Assamese harvest festival celebrated with dance, music, and feasting.
significance: Marks the Assamese New Year and harvest season.

title: Durga Puja
description: Durga Puja celebrates Goddess Durga’s victory over Mahishasura.
significance: Symbolizes power and feminine strength.

title: Raksha Bandhan
description: Celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters with rakhi tying.
significance: Symbol of sibling love and protection.

title: Makar Sankranti
description: Makar Sankranti marks the Sun’s entry into Capricorn and the harvest season.
significance: Welcomes longer days and harvest joy.

title: Janmashtami
description: Marks the birth of Lord Krishna with fasting and midnight prayers.
significance: Celebrates Krishna’s divine playfulness.

title: Karva Chauth
description: Married women fast for the long life of their husbands.
significance: Symbol of devotion and love.

title: Maha Shivaratri
description: Dedicated to Lord Shiva with night-long prayers and fasting.
significance: Represents overcoming darkness and ignorance.

title: Vaisakhi
description: Marks the Punjabi New Year and harvest festival.
significance: Commemorates the formation of the Khalsa.

title: Gudi Padwa
description: Celebrates the Maharashtrian New Year with colorful Gudi flags.
significance: Symbolizes victory and prosperity.

title: Vishu
description: Malayali New Year festival celebrated with Vishukkani ritual.
significance: Marks prosperity and new beginnings.

title: Guru Nanak Jayanti
description: Birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, founder of Sikhism.
significance: Promotes equality, service, and devotion.

title: Lohri
description: Lohri marks the end of winter with bonfires, songs, and dance.
significance: Celebrates harvest and community togetherness.
